Articles.Content: For your infomation it is ona mountion i have made a reserch center there and the base of it is 2375 meters above the lowest point on the mun
Can I suggest a name for the KSC2 complex?

Ksc2 already has a name - its "ksc2". ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). You can name the region around it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Greetings again, members of the KGSS!

Once again I apply for naming a kerbographic feature, however this time it is (maybe) a major one!

The required data can be found below.

Name: Monster Bay

Coordinates: 28Ã‚Â° 8' 39" N|84Ã‚Â° 15' 51"W

> 
> ![screenshot28.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot28.png)
> 
> Here you can see the location and the coordinates.
> 
> ![screenshot30.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot30.png)
> 
> A bit closer. Can you see why I suggest this name? No? Well, then look below.
> 
> ![MonsterBay.jpg](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/MonsterBay.jpg)
> 
> At least to me and with quite a bit of imagination, 1 looks like some kind of ear, 2 looks like an eye, 3 looks like a mouth (including a tooth) and 4 looks like some kind of hand.
> 
> 

I also apply for naming an island. The discoverer, Ferzor Kerman, sadly couldn't come back to his family because he fell off the ladder when he wanted to climb back into his ship and died.

Name(first option, this should be used if the name "Monster Bay" for the area the island is in gets approved): Ferzor Eyeland

Name(second option, this should be used if the above name is not used): Ferzor Kerman Memorial Island

Coordinates: 28Ã‚Â° 8' 39" N|84Ã‚Â° 15' 51"W

> 
> Just look at the screenshots above. The coordinates are the coordinates of the island.
> 
> ![screenshot25.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot25.png)
> 
> Ferzor Kerman on the island. You can see his spaceship, the Kerbin Explorer Beta, in the background.
> 
> ![screenshot29.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot29.png)
> 
> The island seen from above.
> 
> 

And now the most major feature I apply to name: The Jebediah Kerman Crater!

Name: Jebediah Kerman Crater

Coordinates: 4Ã‚Â° 20' 8" S|90Ã‚Â° 59' 2" E

> 
> ![screenshot22%20%282%29.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot22%20%282%29.png)
> 
> Coordinates and location.
> 
> ![screenshot21%20%282%29.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot21%20%282%29.png)
> 
> Jebediah Kerman on top of his rover.
> 
> 

I understand that polls will be required for naming some of these features.

Again, thanks for reading and hopefully considering the names!

Live long and prosper!

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-25T17:00:39Z" title="08/25/2012 05:00  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 25, 2012</time> by Mr\_Brain**

Hello, I would humbly request to have the crater found at 37 Degrees, 48 minutes 58 seconds South and 355 Degrees, 44 Minutes 44 Seconds west be named Armstrong Crater, in honor of his passing.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]31892[/ATTACH]

And here is the image of my craft arrived there. 

[ATTACH=CONFIG]31893[/ATTACH]

I can provide more pictures of the descent and landing site if needed.
I support the request of the player above me.

> 
> I support the request of the player above me.

I also agree! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Having just found this and being fascinated by the idea- I agree completely with the two above me! Any chance of an annotated map? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here is the most recent set of maps I believe. I'm no expert though-I'm just getting into the magic that is Kerbal Space Program. 

[http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10088-Invention-Kerbin-Geographic-And-Science-Society?p=231410&viewfull=1#post231410](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10088-Invention-Kerbin-Geographic-And-Science-Society?p=231410&viewfull=1#post231410)
first off al tassyr outdated second armstrong crater i so agree
I support the name Armstrong Crater.

I propose naming a geographical feature on the surface of Mun "Apollo's Stamp" because it looks like the letter A.

Pictures are [here](http://imgur.com/a/TR9ZA) due to large image size.

Co-ordinates are 0.4N - 0.4S, 24E - 25.3E

Max elevation is ~800m.

We'll name the crater that apollo landed in (co ordinates in other thread) "armstrong crater" and the exact location the lunar module touched down as "Eagles landing".

Screenshots posted shortly. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Oh, okay, well, seeing as how Armstrong crater will be used for another crater, may I request a different name for the crater?

I propose Conrad Crater. He, along with Armstrong, was one of my astronaut heroes.

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-27T07:29:17Z" title="08/27/2012 07:29  AM" data-short="11 yr">August 27, 2012</time> by blueshirt21**
I need to determine if you've actually picked armstrong crater by accident/coincidence. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Oh! Well, when I picked out the crater, I pulled up a map real quick of the Moon, and sorta landed in the general area. But I believe the Sea of Tranquility is a bit more north of where I landed.

So we'll have to go with blueshirts original nomination. Seems the crater I want to call "Armstrong's Crater" is already claimed unofficially as "Silisko's Crater".

Here is the latest Mun map with Armstrong's Crater and Eagles Landing marked. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> ![munsites.jpg](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/80858415/munsites.jpg)

Isn't "Armstrong Crater" on that map actually one of the (*still* unnamed) maria?

If so, perhaps "Mare Armstrong" or something along those lines might be better. Or pick some other name for the sea, especially since we have the landing (and Silisko's memorial, come 0.17) further north.

Not to dismiss the sentiment and/or accomplishment, but the name doesn't fit the feature.
It's up to the community. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What do ppl think?
I'm fine with Mare Armstrong or Armstrong Crater-whatever is more technically accurate.

I propose naming this crater 'Owaku Crater'.

[spoiler=]

![03TNL.png](http://i.imgur.com/03TNL.png)

![JB83Y.png](http://i.imgur.com/JB83Y.png)

And I do agree with 'Mare Armstrong'.

Hey guys, I know the fiction board was taken down, but every time I look at this area, it for some reason makes me feel really good. SO I want to designate this area:

[![NEW_ZOKESIA.png](http://s19.postimage.org/k6oqd76df/NEW_ZOKESIA.png)](http://postimage.org/)

The country of Zokesia.

I love this area, with its islands and peninsulas, it is so beautiful.... I imagine it would look like England.

God save the King!

EDIT:

Im going to write a journal on everything about the country, form its landmarks to its culture, government, etc......

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-28T16:53:41Z" title="08/28/2012 04:53  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 28, 2012</time> by zekes**
I LOVE what you are doing with this thread. This project is amazing in so many ways. KEEP IT UP ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png)

Hey all; i'm going to be pleased working with this and can't wait for new planets. In the meanwhile i'm going to claim the name for one of Minmus' most outstanding features. I want to know if it's been claimed yet.

![plateau1.png](http://img267.imageshack.us/img267/6794/plateau1.png)

![plateau2.png](http://img823.imageshack.us/img823/339/plateau2.png)

![plateau3.png](http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/9919/plateau3.png)

As you can see this huge plateau stands up from the otherwise random landscape; it's easy to notice but i still can't find it in the Quikgrid. So i propose to name it Colossus Plateau; in honor of the Apollo guidance computer OS that guided Apollo 8 around the moon in the first circumlunar flight; and also because it is so amazingly defined as if it was carved out of the ice by a giant. Along with the main geographical feature, i also request that the Area defined by a rectangle from 11Ã‚Â°36'31''N - 253Ã‚Â°57'24"W to 11Ã‚Â°39'24"N - 254Ã‚Â°0'52" be from now on referred to as the New Montreal Surface Base.

The landing of those probes was quite uneventful; Minsat 3 landed practically on the other side of Minmus then made a ballistic hop and adjusted for a precise landing next to it. Both probes have at least 50% fuel left and next stop might be those methane lakes.

I inquire; who has the best map of Minmus?

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-28T07:21:57Z" title="08/28/2012 07:21  AM" data-short="11 yr">August 28, 2012</time> by Lunik**

Thanks simple. I cant quite pick that on the map but it should be fine. Its a large crater so others can also nominate.

Zekes, you've got quite a large area there but it is well defined. Lets name it as you suggest tentatively for now. Definately poll material.

Thanks for the feedback ben ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Lunik, you shold be okay with hat. Not much on mn,us has been claimed. Raw maps in csv format are aalable n the original post along with some images. Starting on the last page and working backwards will show the latest maps with names. Remember the maps are provided by the community for the community. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
